issue.title: [PDTS] directory_iterator underspecified
issue.discussion:
The behaviour of increment is underspecified: What happens if the implementation detects an endless loop (e.g. caused by links)? What happens with automounting and possible race conditions?
More information on this can be found here.
Suggested action:
Specify the required behaviour in these cases.
2014-02-13 Beman Dawes
Suggest NAD. increment takes an error_code& ec argument and its error reporting is no different from any other function in the library with such an argument. 7 Error reporting [fs.err.report] and other front matter already answer the questions posed in great detail.
It might be a bit clearer to globally change "Throws: as specified in Error reporting." to "Remarks: Errors are reported as specified in 7 [fs.err.report]" so that it is clearer that both throwing and non-throwing signatures are covered.
